author: Staff Reporter
text:
Villagers of N. Pudupatti Panchayat in Mohanur Union threatened to boycott the elections if polling booth was not established in their village.

There are over 100 families residing at Melapatti, Melapatti Pudur and Therku Thottam in which 250 voters are there.

Though a primary school was located at Melapatti, the polling booth was located only in middle school at Rama Udayanur which is about three km. from their village.

Villagers said that reaching the polling booth takes time and is extremely difficult for the senior citizens. They demanded that polling booth be established in the school at Melapatti.

They also threatened to boycott the elections if their demands are not met. Villagers staged protest on Friday as Mohanur police rushed to the spot and pacified them. They assured to take up the issue with election officials. Later, villagers withdrew their protest.
title: Villagers demand polling booth, threaten to boycott polls
